shared_text:
Tri-City United LeCenter K-8
June 2 at 12:20 PM ·

Well Titan Nation, it is official. We have received confirmation by the Minnesota Department of Education and the Minnesota Positive Behavioral Interventions and Supports (PBIS) State Leadership Team that TCU Le Center K-8 School is being recognized as a "2020 Sustaining Exemplar PBIS School!"

We will be apart of a virtual ceremony to honor our PBIS sustainability efforts and our school. The ceremony will be held on June 10th from 11:30am-12:30pm. During this time there will be a short presentation, recorded highlights of exemplar schools and districts, and speakers from MDE and the PBIS State Leadership Team. Regional Coordinators from the Metro, North and South will be speaking on behalf of the great work we have done to contribute to student success.

Way to go Titans!

Announcement

TCU Montgomery Indoor Pool suspended until Phase III of the ‘Stay Safe MN’ Plan

The Tri-City United School District is saddened to report that the TCU Montgomery Indoor Pool will be closed for the month of June due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. At the recommendation of Governor Tim Walz and the MN Department of Health, it has been determined to be unsafe to the community to open the pool at this time. We will continue to monitor the pool opening under Governor Tim Walz’s ‘Stay Safe MN’ Plan to determine about the possibility of opening in July.

Thank you to all who helped out this year.

No Kidding Around!

The TCU Community Education Department is proud to announce that starting on Monday, October 7th, we'll be offering morning KidZone child care in Le Center during the school year. This offering provides another option to the families in the TCU School District. Our KidZone child care program is a before and after school program for students in grades K-6, the new addition of KidZone Wrap now also provides care during the school day for Preschool students ages 3.5 years old and up enrolled in our Little Titans program.

To go along with this new offering to the community, we'll also have KidZone open over MEA in all three sites. KidZone also provides care on 2-hour late starts, early release days, weather related days and/or non-school days.

For more information and how to register, please contact KidZone/Youth Enrichment Coordinator Jesse Siebsen for more details at jsiebsen@tcu2905.us

Women in Aviation Day! This past Saturday, TCU students enjoyed an awesome day at Premier Jet Center at Flying Cloud Airport in Eden Prairie. Girls in Aviation Day was originally created to increase female participation and enthusiasm for careers in Science, Technology, Engineering, Math (STEM) and aviation.

Students took part in activities that encompassed physics, riveting, airspace, meteorology, and many more from industry leaders with a passion for aviation. In the exhibitor hangar, professionals shared stories and information about universities, engineering firms, military careers and much more!

Outside, the flight line was filled with airplanes ranging from a historical P-51 Mustang and T-6 Texan to Canadair Regional Jet and Cirrus SR-22 aircraft. There was something for everyone! Go Titans!

Dear TCU Community: We are saddened to share that a dedicated educator, Carol Lilla, had a medical emergency today & sadly has passed away. She loved being a Teacher & supporting our students. Staff & those closest to her all feel that in order to best honor her passion for TCU activities, we will go ahead with tonight's TCU Titan football game. We will have a moment of silence and staff tribute.

As another means of honoring her and all she has contributed to our students, schools, and communities, we will not be charging a ticket fee this evening and instead offer those in attendance the opportunity to give a donation as a memorial or welcome you to make a donation to Tackle Cancer.

Thank you for your kindness & support.
